sound

Class SequencePlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • sound.SequencePlayer

  • public class SequencePlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Schedules and plays a sequence of notes at given time steps (or "ticks").

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SequencePlayer(int beatsPerMinute, int ticksPerBeat, LyricListener listener) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addLyricEvent(java.lang.String text, int tick)
      Schedules a lyric event to be triggered at tick.
      void addNote(int note, int startTick, int numTicks)
      Schedules the note to be played starting at startTick for the duration of numTicks.
      void play()
      The sequencer is opened to begin playing its track.
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SequencePlayer

        public SequencePlayer(int beatsPerMinute,
              int ticksPerBeat,
              LyricListener listener)
               throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException,
                      javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Parameters:
        beatsPerMinute - the number of beats per minute
        ticksPerBeat - the number of ticks per beat
        listener - the listener that responds to lyric events
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException

    • Method Detail

      • addLyricEvent

        public void addLyricEvent(java.lang.String text,
                 int tick)
        Schedules a lyric event to be triggered at tick. When the lyric event is triggered, the SequencePlayer's MetaEventListener is alerted.
        Parameters:
        text - a string containing the lyric text
        tick - the starting tick; must be >= 0

      • addNote

        public void addNote(int note,
           int startTick,
           int numTicks)
        Schedules the note to be played starting at startTick for the duration of numTicks.
        Parameters:
        note - the pitch value for the note to be played; must be a valid note
        startTick - the starting tick; must be >= 0
        numTicks - the number of ticks for which this note should be played; must be >= 0

      • play

        public void play()
          throws javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException
        The sequencer is opened to begin playing its track.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.MidiUnavailableException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string that displays the entire track information as a sequence of MIDI events, where each event is either turning on or off a note at a certain tick
